author: Tyler Sullivan
title: Fantasy focus
text:
Each Sunday during the NFL season, the Herald provides its ideal lineup for daily fantasy football players.
Here are our best bets for Week 6:
SALARY CAP: $50,000
•   QB: Tom Brady, Patriots at Colts ($8,100) — Brady is going to have a Tom Brady performance tonight.
•   RB: Eddie Lacy, Packers vs. Chargers ($6,300) — He’s been a disappointment, but San Diego is the league’s third-worst against the run.
•    RB: Dion Lewis, Patriots at Colts ($5,800) — He’ll show Indy why they shouldn’t have cut him last year.
•    WR: Calvin Johnson, Lions vs. Bears ($7,300) — A top-5 wide receiver going up against a bad secondary.
•      WR: Brandon Marshall, Jets vs. Redskins ($7,100) — Has at least seven catches and 100 yards receiving in each of his last three games.
•     WR: DeVante Parker, Dolphins at Titans ($3,000) — He has to break out some point, right? This is the day.
•     TE: Tyler Eifert, Bengals at Bills ($4,900) — Outside of Gronk, this is the tight end you want.
•    Flex: LeGarrette Blount, Patriots at Colts ($4,400) — I see a repeat of Week 3, when he scored three times in closing out a blowout.
•     D/ST: Jets vs. Redskins ($3,100) — Facing a banged up receiving corps and an inexperienced QB.
